title: 110_hr1376
content: The Act titled "Medicaid Foster Care Coverage Act of 2007" establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage. The Act establishes independent foster care adolescents as a mandatory category for Medicaid coverage, with amendments to the Social Security Act. The Act mandates Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents, with amendments to the Social Security Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Amendments include changes to sections 1905(w) and 1902 of the Act. The Social Security Act is amended to include Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Amendments are made to sections 1902 and 1903 of the Act, updating specific subparagraphs and subsections. Amendments are made to sections 1902 and 1903 of the Social Security Act, updating specific subparagraphs and subsections related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Amendments are made to sections 1902 and 1903 of the Social Security Act, updating specific subparagraphs and subsections related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Section 1905 of the Act is also amended to adjust certain subsections. Amendments are made to sections 1902 and 1903 of the Social Security Act, updating specific subparagraphs and subsections related to Medicaid coverage for independent foster care adolescents. Section 1905 of the Act is also amended to adjust certain subsections by changing specific references. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, updating specific subparagraphs and subsections related to Medicaid coverage. Specific references are adjusted in sections 1902, 1903, and 1905 of the Act. Amendments are made to sections of the Social Security Act, updating specific references in Medicaid coverage. Amendments to the Social Security Act update references in Medicaid coverage, with changes effective starting October 1, 2007. The amendments to the Social Security Act regarding Medicaid coverage are effective for calendar quarters starting on or after October 1, 2007, regardless of the status of final regulations. State plans requiring legislation to meet the new requirements will not be considered failing. The Social Security Act requires State legislation for Medicaid plans to meet new requirements. State plans will not be considered failing for not meeting these requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the State legislature's session following the enactment of the Act. The Social Security Act mandates State Medicaid plans to meet new requirements. Plans won't be deemed failing for not meeting these requirements before the first day of the first calendar quarter after the State legislature's session following the Act's enactment.
